thread.title: Molly Huddle wins 4th straight Tufts 10k title
thread.title_full: Molly Huddle wins 4th straight Tufts 10k title | Boston Herald

author: Dan Keats
title: Molly Huddle wins 4th straight Tufts 10k title
text:
The Tufts Health Care 10K for Women annually brings together a top field of runners. That the race also served as the USA Track & Field 2015 10K Women's Championship only upped the quality for the 39th running.
Molly Huddle quickly got out in front of the rest of the field and captured her fourth Tufts title in a time of 31:21, setting a course record and the American 10K road record.
With temperatures in the low 70s and nobody able push her, Huddle's hopes of breaking 31:03, the American 10K record on the track set by Shalane Flanagan, were dashed.
The victory is the fourth straight national title for the 31-year-old Huddle, joining wins in the 20K, 5K and last weekend's 10 mile.
Huddle gained a little bit of unwanted notoriety earlier this summer when she pulled up just before the finish line‎ of the 10,000m race at the World Championships in Beijing, only to be passed, costing her the bronze medal.
Providence College graduate Emily Sisson finished second, nearly a minute back in 32:18.‎
Three-time Tufts 10K champion and 1984 Olympic Marathon gold medalist Joan Benoit Samuelson, 58, was among the field of approximately 5,000 runners, which included a visually impaired category for the first time. ‎
